it's mostly just type annotations.

Note that because of how the 'nova.objects' module works, we need to
delay interpolation by using forward references, or expressing the type
as string literals to be resolved later [1].

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0484/#forward-references

Change-Id: I2a609606806c6cabdf95d53339335f61743fc5b0

commit_message:
mypy: Add type annotations to 'nova.pci'

The 'nova.pci' module is poorly understood and difficult to debug.
Start adding type hints to make this a little easier to parse and catch
dumb errors. Some code needs to be reworked to make 'mypy' happy, but
it's mostly just type annotations.

Note that because of how the 'nova.objects' module works, we need to
delay interpolation by using forward references, or expressing the type
as string literals to be resolved later [1].

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0484/#forward-references

Change-Id: I2a609606806c6cabdf95d53339335f61743fc5b0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 33370, 'date': '2021-05-17 12:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33370, 'date': '2021-05-17 12:46:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Review regarding migration from testr to stestr under OSC-5 of RHOSC'21"}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-05-19 11:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm, thanks'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-05-20 08:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-06-01 02:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-17 12:45:23.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore, test-requirements.txt and lower-constraints.txt
  files accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox and 3.18.0 as the
  minversion for tox
* Add a new job, openstack-cover-jobs, to run the coverage in Zuul
* Create cover environment in tox and make relevant changes
  in .gitignore

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3de659cdda2f490590dbfb38c81b95becac5da7c
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore, test-requirements.txt and lower-constraints.txt
  files accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox and 3.18.0 as the
  minversion for tox
* Add a new job, openstack-cover-jobs, to run the coverage in Zuul
* Create cover environment in tox and make relevant changes
  in .gitignore

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3de659cdda2f490590dbfb38c81b95becac5da7c

package metadata to reflect that py3.8 is now supported.

[{'created': '2020-06-08 14:45:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox from test-requirements

The mox library (not even mox3) was used with py27, and is not actually
being used anymore. This cleans up the test-requirements file so we can
remove mox from global requirements.

Change-Id: I67beef36094e514485e77a810312fecb2b7e6c9e

commit_message:
Remove mox from test-requirements

The mox library (not even mox3) was used with py27, and is not actually
being used anymore. This cleans up the test-requirements file so we can
remove mox from global requirements.

Change-Id: I67beef36094e514485e77a810312fecb2b7e6c9e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix Storyboard link to use openstack/heat

For sub-projects with no specific team to manage, we use directly
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/openstack/heat instead of
openstack/heat-cfnclient(Which migrated from Launchpad).

[{'created': '2021-05-26 20:28:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use dogpile.cache.memcached in nova caching

According to the latest keystone configuration help,
dogpile.cache.memcached is more recommended option in TripleO
deployment than oslo_cache.memcache_pool, because it uses httpd+wsgi
to run apis and has less than 100 threaded servers.

This patch replaces backend used in nova caching, and also introduces
the new parameter tripleo::profile::base::nova::cache_backend so that
operators can use another backend if they want.

Change-Id: I36c0c474fb5e665392c1fb8d93dc3949ab6e8b67
(cherry picked from commit 8d4ea840bf15d52368f6f7ced8323fc4f978bb8e)
'}]
commit_message:
Use dogpile.cache.memcached in nova caching

According to the latest keystone configuration help,
dogpile.cache.memcached is more recommended option in TripleO
deployment than oslo_cache.memcache_pool, because it uses httpd+wsgi
to run apis and has less than 100 threaded servers.

This patch replaces backend used in nova caching, and also introduces
the new parameter tripleo::profile::base::nova::cache_backend so that
operators can use another backend if they want.

Change-Id: I36c0c474fb5e665392c1fb8d93dc3949ab6e8b67
(cherry picked from commit 8d4ea840bf15d52368f6f7ced8323fc4f978bb8e)

commit_message:
Automaticaly set cipher suite

In some cases the operator can't specify `ipmi_cipher_suite`
for each node and the problem with session can still occour:
`Error in open session response message : no matching cipher suite`

This patch adds a new configuration option that will take a list
of possible cipher suite versions that can be used when the error
occurs and the node doesn't have the `ipmi_cipher_suite` set.

Story: 2008739
Task: 42093
Change-Id: I6788585a83268e20ff6447e570995871bc9c25d5
(cherry picked from commit b029fb377001cfe5d727ead1d2a26535c720b381)
(cherry picked from commit a036728fb4ca7acfe19e14f2a1f89c19ef30fe98)

commit_message:
Dynamically compute nova_scheduler_host_subset_size value

Having this variable set to 10 might be a very bad option for small environments. From the other side, switching back to nova default value(1) also has another disadvantages. I think the best option is to add some logic here and compute a proper value based on number of compute nodes

Change-Id: I073875d380b14771cff434620553eada5068a430

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 19:24:35.000000000', 'message': "Quote paths before sending them to swob.Request.blank

Following the fix for https://bugs.python.org/issue43882, our py39 unit
tests started failing. This was because swob.Request.blank calls
stdlib's urlparse, which now strips out newlines. Since Request.blank
*also* always unquotes, just make sure we always quote the newlines we
want to use while testing.

Change-Id: Ia5857c70e51d8af3e42ecaced95525be578db127
"}]
commit_message:
Quote paths before sending them to swob.Request.blank

Following the fix for https://bugs.python.org/issue43882, our py39 unit
tests started failing. This was because swob.Request.blank calls
stdlib's urlparse, which now strips out newlines. Since Request.blank
*also* always unquotes, just make sure we always quote the newlines we
want to use while testing.

Change-Id: Ia5857c70e51d8af3e42ecaced95525be578db127

commit_message:
Make ceph-nfs service source path for /etc/ceph configurable

Within the container this directory will always appear mounted in
/etc/ceph but the ceph_client role itself might have generated it
in a different path (on the host) depending on CephConfigPath param

Change-Id: I12155b4a88b811d701f9fb6d1506b5592b58767b

commit_message:
Expose the monitoring_stack network to cephadm

cephadm accepts a network parameter, which is used by the rendered spec
to identify the network address block used to deploy a given daemon.
This patch just exposes (like we've done for RGW and Ganesha) the
network where the monitoring stack components (node-exporter, prometheus
and alertmanager) should be bound.

Depends-On: I59a74797dc97540b7553a3e74f67e23e6ccc8f6d
Change-Id: Icc779d7d2608e5a8c1fbc68973a987a9c268244d
(cherry picked from commit 5369ff9bdeda9c43718afd1afc05345451356761)

commit_message:
Re-add NovaVncProxyNetwork to service_net_map.j2.yaml

Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2 removed the NovaVncProxyNetwork
from network/service_net_map.j2.yaml, but due to how hieradata is
being rendered via tripleo-hieradata, the hieradata for the no-vnc-proxy
service falls back to the control plane network.

Change-Id: I595294956a4a7a0e2280c685ac1d2543edbc32f2
Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960401
(cherry picked from commit 36648cf7f041e8a0e5cc8070c1b96b57472c96a8)
(cherry picked from commit 326452e5851e8347b15b53c3d6b70e6f5225f3ea)
(cherry picked from commit b6d85231a6791927b598e2f7aa0cfbe166609524)

commit_message:
[ffwd] Add legacy cinderv3 volume cleanup to postupgrade

The postupgrade tasks are now taking care of making the keystone
endpoints but they will fail on legacy cinder. We add the
removal of legacy cinderv3 volume entries to keystone postupgrade.

Resolves: rhbz#1960579
Change-Id: Idb3a11d6904c6c36eca9d415734ce27af49553f9

commit_message:
trivial: Make driver_controller's _attrs_to_driver py3 compatible

In python3 dict.values() doesn't return list but instead dict_values,
it must be converted to list to "enjoy" list operations like insert.
Add unit tests to be sure.

Closes-Bug: #1923423
Change-Id: Ie270ac2ee65c02bdb099d11af7f1d2fb62ad0f61
(cherry picked from commit e270ac2ee65c02bdb099d11af7f1d2fb62ad0f61)

commit_message:
[ovs fw] Restrict IPv6 NA and DHCP(v6) IP and MAC source addresses

Neighbor Advertisments are used to inform other machines of the MAC
address to use to reach an IPv6. This commits prevents VMs from
pretending they are assigned IPv6 they should not use.

It also prevents sending UDP packets with spoofed IP or MAC even using
DHCP(v6) request ports.

Co-authored-by: David Sinquin <david.sinquin@gandi.net>

Closes-bug: #1902917

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/firewall.py

Change-Id: Iffb6643359562487414460f5a7e19a7fae9f935c
(cherry picked from commit ca7822e2108c151bda992ef8a6d454ec2c6d890e)

commit_message:
Disable Cinder v2 API

Cinder v2 API has been deprecated in Pike and it make sense to
disable it's creation by default. Doing this we also will drop catalog
records and service during upgrade

Change-Id: I11986bfe6d2af5e671b7008a71a58538d0576336

commit_message:
Remove placement channel from gerritbot

As placement repo is now under Nova governance, placement
channel is agreed to be merged to nova channel
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/019092.html

All the repos which were for placement channel gerritbot are
already under nova channel bot list.

Change-Id: I5996facf9c819ed853d90cc87906250037853627

The Ceph setting might be useful in CI but do now lower the memory
consumption and are actually harmful because misconfigure the
cluster without replicas which makes it also useless to test any
upgrade or update scenario.

Change-Id: Iefb9cd3b619874c2374e0eeb6db374233583094f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Ceph cluster replica and PG num from low-memory-usage.yaml

The Ceph setting might be useful in CI but do now lower the memory
consumption and are actually harmful because misconfigure the
cluster without replicas which makes it also useless to test any
upgrade or update scenario.

Change-Id: Iefb9cd3b619874c2374e0eeb6db374233583094f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 10:04:46.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Set oc_container_cli for checks during ffu

Furing FFWD workflow, the validation gets triggered as part of the
pre-upgrade group. When it gets triggered, the environment is in
state where the Undercloud has been upgrade to OSP16.1 (container
engine is podman) but the Overcloud nodes are still on OSP13
(container engine is still docker).

This patch is similar to I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
to check which container cli should be used.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1963872

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I15b105d03193a83ab7bbf3e911cbb37974a54495
'}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Set oc_container_cli for checks during ffu

Furing FFWD workflow, the validation gets triggered as part of the
pre-upgrade group. When it gets triggered, the environment is in
state where the Undercloud has been upgrade to OSP16.1 (container
engine is podman) but the Overcloud nodes are still on OSP13
(container engine is still docker).

This patch is similar to I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
to check which container cli should be used.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1963872

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I15b105d03193a83ab7bbf3e911cbb37974a54495

commit_message:
Substitute special characters in resource class

Everything except alphanumeric characters and an underscore needs to
be replaced by an underscore.

Change-Id: Icb30abb9a4f147d8aeddd99908ec29e8ccd63ac6

commit_message:
[DNM] Debug tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider job graph

Testing why https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/793417
fails with Unable to freeze job graph: Job
neutron-centos-8-tripleo-standalone depends on
tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider which was not run.

Change-Id: I2ad63a3c4c37c934ff2211fce896e1711add6fd3

'}, {'created': '2021-05-28 18:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CI issues and adjust test jobs

It is incorrect to install tempest and manila-tempest-plugin
globally in devstack jobs. So this commit removes the use
of the test plugin's devstack installation hook, and uses
a "tempest-venv" that devstack sets up to run the tests.

To allow zuulv3 style jobs elsewhere [1] use the right
api versions when testing against this stable branch,
we enhance the devstack plugin.sh script to set api
versions as tempest configuration options.

Alongside these changes, we can perform a much needed
test job cleanup by eliminating some jobs we don't have
the bandwidth to maintain:

- manila-tempest-dsvm-postgres-generic-singlebackend
  Single backend jobs are not very useful - the job
  sets up a single backend in a multibackend style.
  We've dropped this from future branches, and we
  don't expect this job to catch any regressions that
  other jobs will miss.
- manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-no-share-servers
  This job's been failing; and wasting CI resources.
  We have other DHSS=False reference drivers (CephFS
  native/nfs, ZFSOnLinux, LVM) where we test the
  driver mode sufficiently.
- manila-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs-nfs-heketi
  and manila-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs-native-heketi
  these were in the experimental queue, unmaintained
- manila-tempest-dsvm-container-scenario-custom-image
  and manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-scenario-custom-image
  New zuulv3 style jobs in the manila-image-elements
  project replace these jobs [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/725692
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-image-elements/src/commit/9c00e86d17a3487c9467dbedfe09a0d5623974b5/zuul.d/manila-image-elements-jobs.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1928880
Depends-On: I2eceb1d5fe42b1b779e115a0144a5d9639d3753f
Change-Id: I6c7db2286d544ff8156926e07efd57628cfdc9ff
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CI issues and adjust test jobs

It is incorrect to install tempest and manila-tempest-plugin
globally in devstack jobs. So this commit removes the use
of the test plugin's devstack installation hook, and uses
a "tempest-venv" that devstack sets up to run the tests.

To allow zuulv3 style jobs elsewhere [1] use the right
api versions when testing against this stable branch,
we enhance the devstack plugin.sh script to set api
versions as tempest configuration options.

Alongside these changes, we can perform a much needed
test job cleanup by eliminating some jobs we don't have
the bandwidth to maintain:

- manila-tempest-dsvm-postgres-generic-singlebackend
  Single backend jobs are not very useful - the job
  sets up a single backend in a multibackend style.
  We've dropped this from future branches, and we
  don't expect this job to catch any regressions that
  other jobs will miss.
- manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-no-share-servers
  This job's been failing; and wasting CI resources.
  We have other DHSS=False reference drivers (CephFS
  native/nfs, ZFSOnLinux, LVM) where we test the
  driver mode sufficiently.
- manila-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs-nfs-heketi
  and manila-tempest-dsvm-glusterfs-native-heketi
  these were in the experimental queue, unmaintained
- manila-tempest-dsvm-container-scenario-custom-image
  and manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-scenario-custom-image
  New zuulv3 style jobs in the manila-image-elements
  project replace these jobs [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/725692
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-image-elements/src/commit/9c00e86d17a3487c9467dbedfe09a0d5623974b5/zuul.d/manila-image-elements-jobs.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1928880
Depends-On: I2eceb1d5fe42b1b779e115a0144a5d9639d3753f
Change-Id: I6c7db2286d544ff8156926e07efd57628cfdc9ff
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

resources into one commit.

Set up tag hints on all OS::Neutron::Port resources.
The network-data-v2 work uses tags on neutron resources
to find existing resources so that we update instead
of create. Also for generating environment files info
in the neutron tag field is utilized.

commit_message:
Set tags on all OS::Neutron::Port resources

This combines several changes that added tags to port
resources into one commit.

Set up tag hints on all OS::Neutron::Port resources.
The network-data-v2 work uses tags on neutron resources
to find existing resources so that we update instead
of create. Also for generating environment files info
in the neutron tag field is utilized.

Conflicts:
  network/ports/deployed_port.j2

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
(cherry picked from commit 28f2a709124f62469acafb64110f755edec82636)

commit_message:
Change minversion of tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals option.
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Icf591aabde39489f539f2ca09ee59ba7c58e98a7

(6 comments)

It looks like there's some inconsistencies around become: true. Is this command run as root normally?"}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> (6 comments)
> 
> It looks like there's some inconsistencies around become: true. Is this command run as root normally?

It is true that there are inconsistencies with the usage of become: true. The playbook is always run with --become on the command, as almost all tasks need root access. To solve it, we have decided that the best is not tu use become: true in any task, as it will be invoked primarily via the openstack backup CLI, which is already passing the --become parameter to the ansible-playbook command.

I have submitted a dependent change that removes any use of become: true from the role in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/792978.

Also, now ss is used instead of netstat."}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-05-26 08:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-14 12:34:50.000000000', 'message': 'Achieve idempotency during backup & restore

This change introduces the modifications needed for the playbook to run
no matter what state is the system when the playbook started. It also
adds an error control section to leave the system untouched in case of a
backup failure.

Change-Id: Id2aff61f219b0c4992f6f0045f1aba2c7d129758
'}, {'created': '2021-05-14 12:37:39.000000000', 'message': "Make execution of the backup idempotent

Currently, the playbook stops the services and the pacemaker to perform the backup. If the backup fails for whatever reason, the playbook cannot run again and fails due to the services being down. This patch fixes the issue in two directions. First, by using the block-always ansible feature, we ensure that whenever an error happens, the playbook will restart the pacemaker and the services before exiting.

The second direction is on the execution itself. By controlling certain actions, we ensure that the backup will be succesful not matter what state the services and the pacemaker are when the playbook is ran. This ensures success even in the case an operator stops the ansible execution manually (which will not trigger the 'always' condition).

BZ: #1954818
Change-Id: Id2aff61f219b0c4992f6f0045f1aba2c7d129758

commit_message:
Make execution of the backup idempotent

Currently, the playbook stops the services and the pacemaker to perform the backup. If the backup fails for whatever reason, the playbook cannot run again and fails due to the services being down. This patch fixes the issue in two directions. First, by using the block-always ansible feature, we ensure that whenever an error happens, the playbook will restart the pacemaker and the services before exiting.

The second direction is on the execution itself. By controlling certain actions, we ensure that the backup will be succesful not matter what state the services and the pacemaker are when the playbook is ran. This ensures success even in the case an operator stops the ansible execution manually (which will not trigger the 'always' condition).

BZ: #1954818
Change-Id: Id2aff61f219b0c4992f6f0045f1aba2c7d129758

commit_message:
Release python-tackerclient for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for ospython-tackerclient for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.6.0..b5603cc
b5603cc Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual
a7ee00e Add Python3 xena unit tests
785c6db Adds support force delete VNFFG
124be38 Fix failing UT in TestListVnfLcmOp

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Expose the monitoring_stack network to cephadm

cephadm accepts a network parameter, which is used by the rendered spec
to identify the network address block used to deploy a given daemon.
This patch just exposes (like we've done for RGW and Ganesha) the
network where the monitoring stack components (node-exporter, prometheus
and alertmanager) should be bound.

Depends-On: I59a74797dc97540b7553a3e74f67e23e6ccc8f6d
Change-Id: Icc779d7d2608e5a8c1fbc68973a987a9c268244d

commit_message:
Add the networks parameter to the monitoring stack components

As per [1] the ceph_mkspec module accepts the networks parameter
that defines where the specified daemon should be bound.
This patch adds the existing parameter to the monitoring stack
tasks that are supposed to apply node-exporter(s), prometheus
and alertmanager when DashboardEnabled is true.
In addition, due to recent changes in Ceph, both grafana and
the dashboard passwords must be passed via `-i`. This change
makes us able to configure the password via stdin.
Finally, the tls support is added to the grafana component,
which is exposed to the operators.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/783305

Change-Id: I59a74797dc97540b7553a3e74f67e23e6ccc8f6d
(cherry picked from commit 7e7db792d25ef5ee6f8343fda91b42c5ccdd1746)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-12 16:01:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add BGP router-id and resolve-via-default options

The BGP Router Identifier is automatically set as the highest IPv4
address configured on the loopback interface or alternatively from a
physical interface. Thus the router ID may be set to an undesired value.
We are better of explicitely, predictably setting it to the main host
IPv4 address.

In addition, allow the nexthop tracking to resolve via the default
route. This is useful when e.g. you want to allow BGP to peer across the
default route, and MP-BGP EVPN use cases.

Change-Id: Ib22700a80bf96e595103e68a51b2bbdf951892bb
'}]
commit_message:
Add BGP router-id and resolve-via-default options

The BGP Router Identifier is automatically set as the highest IPv4
address configured on the loopback interface or alternatively from a
physical interface. Thus the router ID may be set to an undesired value.
We are better of explicitely, predictably setting it to the main host
IPv4 address.

In addition, allow the nexthop tracking to resolve via the default
route. This is useful when e.g. you want to allow BGP to peer across the
default route, and MP-BGP EVPN use cases.

Change-Id: Ib22700a80bf96e595103e68a51b2bbdf951892bb

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2014-10-21 21:51:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

On general level, I'm not sure I understand how the scheme will work. The current status is that Neutron server allocates IP addresses for ports, persists them in db, and runs dnsmasq with mac-to-ip-address mapping file.

With the relay scheme you propose, IP addresses will be allocated by an external DHCP server, their mapping to mac address will be also externalized, there will be no persistence on Neutron side etc.

If Neutron won't be aware of IP addresses assigned to ports, where will Nova gather information about allocated IP addresses?

It seems that if the scheme is going to be implemented, it will require a very major rework on DHCP agent side. I think spec lacks a lot of needed details for this kind of change."}, {'account_id': 11780, 'date': '2014-10-21 23:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-21 23:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-neutron-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/60/105660/10/check/gate-neutron-specs-docs/ac63126/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 39s
- gate-neutron-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/60/105660/10/check/gate-neutron-specs-python27/0e4b1df : SUCCESS in 2m 33s'}, {'account_id': 11780, 'date': '2014-10-21 23:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I updated the spec to clarify and answer your question. The MAC and IP Address allocation and change by Neutron are synchronized with external DHCP Server. The use of centralized IPAM is one method to accomplish this see: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ipam'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2014-11-08 22:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2014-11-10 21:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

The spec is not bad, but we just need to frame it into the larger set of IPAM related transformations we plan for Kilo.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2014-12-02 19:53:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

(2 comments)

Aloha, this is showing no activity.
I think it's a thing we might want to introduce in Kilo, especially with the pluggable IPAM changes coming in.
I will take ownership of this spec if no activity from the author is seen in the next 48 hours."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2014-12-04 03:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

couple of questions inline'}, {'account_id': 12912, 'date': '2014-12-04 14:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)

Thanks for the reviews. In fact though if we are going to add the DHCP relay I recommend we take a closer look at [1], for the reason mentioned on my comment on line 106. Additionally, for [1] a single process is required rather than a process per namespace.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/dhcp-cpnr-integration'}, {'account_id': 12912, 'date': '2014-12-04 14:21:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Just re-reading the Don's BP, it doesn't have a spec that talks about the specific design. But from our discussions with him, the primary difference between this design and his is as described above. That is, the implementation there has a single process that has sockets listening in each namespace, rather than a process per namespace.

This enables the process to consume only one IP in the management network, rather than having many processes each with an IP in that network."}, {'account_id': 12912, 'date': '2014-12-04 14:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11780, 'date': '2014-12-04 18:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/describes to bp/dhcp-relay'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2014-12-08 20:26:56.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This change hasn't been updated since October 21, it's being abandoned. Additionally, SPD is today for Kilo, thus this change won't make Kilo unless it's re-proposed today."}, {'account_id': 11241, 'date': '2015-05-18 05:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Is there any other similar work that addresses the DHCP relay, since this is abandoned?'}, {'account_id': 12912, 'date': '2015-05-27 14:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I am considering proposing something similar to this that describes our current implementation that is not (yet) upstream. However, we use a patched ISC dhcrelay which has not been upstreamed by ISC - I was thinking that would be necessary before we could complete this work.'}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2015-05-27 16:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I agree that using a patched version of dhcrelay that can't be obtained through the normal channels in the supported distributions will be a problem.  Are there efforts to upstream this patch?  Any idea if it can make it in to the supported distros?"}, {'account_id': 12912, 'date': '2015-05-27 16:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

The patch was submitted to ISC but did not make it into the latest point release. It's a tiny patch, so hopefully it will go into the next one. From there it has to get packaged by the distros."}, {'account_id': 11061, 'date': '2016-02-24 15:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

John, is there any progress with your patch(es)?  I would like to see your relay implementation.'}, {'account_id': 9367, 'date': '2017-02-13 03:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Does community have any update for this feature?'}, {'account_id': 32184, 'date': '2021-05-31 11:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> Does community have any update for this feature?


Would be nice to have feature, in an organization where site DHCP,DNS exist and could make use of it. Curious to know, if this exists ?
Was searching for this in few other openstack doc pages, have not found any.'}]

commit_message:
DHCP Relay Blueprint

This blueprint describes extending the Openstack DHCP framework to
support forwarding of the DHCP requests to an external DHCP Server.
A DHCP Relay will be implemented to provide the ability to serve VMs
within a tenant network and forward their request to an External DHCP
Server.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/dhcp-relay

Blueprint: dhcp-relay

Change-Id: Icaf88ad5990f87e3c2a1c22a805997c8fac07788

commit_message:
Make test-setup.sh compatible with mysql8

Starting from mysql version 8 it's not possible to create a user
implictly when using GRANT.

This patch makes the behavior compatible with that.

Change-Id: I2b73a532deb8782c2c0bb05070b727e9edc6e9d8
Co-written-by: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 58693c7f4db0c65c8a0ed8037bcacbbf07a7346e)

[{'created': '2021-05-31 09:18:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update project conundrum related docs

Yes, project conundrum is a code-name for our transition to OFTC
as we do not want to put anything into freenode IRC which may abruptly
result in the channel being siezed or shutdown by the new
owners/operators of freenode

Change-Id: I45c07e0b2138f6643f865d58155c64317114fd02

'}]
commit_message:
Update project conundrum related docs

Yes, project conundrum is a code-name for our transition to OFTC
as we do not want to put anything into freenode IRC which may abruptly
result in the channel being siezed or shutdown by the new
owners/operators of freenode

Change-Id: I45c07e0b2138f6643f865d58155c64317114fd02
See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022718.html
(cherry picked from commit d5971fdff2f604ba981357aa3f3e279015780816)

Change-Id: I45c07e0b2138f6643f865d58155c64317114fd02

commit_message:
Update project conundrum related docs

Yes, project conundrum is a code-name for our transition to OFTC
as we do not want to put anything into freenode IRC which may abruptly
result in the channel being siezed or shutdown by the new
owners/operators of freenode

Change-Id: I45c07e0b2138f6643f865d58155c64317114fd02
See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022718.html
(cherry picked from commit d5971fdff2f604ba981357aa3f3e279015780816)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 13:55:05.000000000', 'message': 'Limit the number of malloc arenas for qemu-img convert

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed
in this mannor should the.

Since this is only something which should realistically occur under
heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors
and VMs inside those hypervisors), then a new arena gets created, and
the memory consumption spikes.

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

Change-Id: I8b2b490f2cc0ac5f47c3aaaaa249ce59db6602d6
Story: 2008928
Task: 42529
(cherry picked from commit 76cbb9623f6dc855528ad0d1a614931124c6fd9c)
'}]
commit_message:
Limit the number of malloc arenas for qemu-img convert

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed
in this mannor should the.

Since this is only something which should realistically occur under
heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors
and VMs inside those hypervisors), then a new arena gets created, and
the memory consumption spikes.

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

Change-Id: I8b2b490f2cc0ac5f47c3aaaaa249ce59db6602d6
Story: 2008928
Task: 42529
(cherry picked from commit 76cbb9623f6dc855528ad0d1a614931124c6fd9c)

commit_message:
Limit the number of malloc arenas for qemu-img convert

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed
in this mannor should the.

Since this is only something which should realistically occur under
heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors
and VMs inside those hypervisors), then a new arena gets created, and
the memory consumption spikes.

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

Under heavy load, the qemu-img convert method may attempt to create
additional malloc arenas to complete its work. By default this number
is 8 * ncpu * which at about 250 MB of memory which can be consumed

heavy cross-thread load where memory locking prevents a thread from
unlocking a range of memory, (such as what can happen with hypervisors

More information is avialable at:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Memory-Allocation-Tunables.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 08:20:23.000000000', 'message': 'Support microversion 1.30 - /reshaper API

The new command ``openstack resource provider allocation reshape`` is
now supported. This treats an atomic change of a given consumer as
followings.

* Take off the given amount of allocations on the source resource class
  from the source resource provider
* Remove the same amount of inventories from the source resource
  provider
* Recreate the given amount of inventories of destination resource
  class in the destination resource provider.
* Create the same amount of allocations on the destination resource
  provider for the consumer

An example to move three VGPU allocations of a consumer from compute RP
to VGPU RP with those VGPU inventories::

  openstack resource provider allocation reshape <consumer_uuid> \
    --src-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --remove VGPU=3 \
    --dst-rp <vgpu_rp_uuid> --add VGPU=3

The source and destination resource provider can be the same provider.
Amount can be omitted to move all the allocations for that resource
class of the consumer::

  openstack resource provider reshape <consumer_uuid> \
    --src-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --remove VCPU \
    --dst-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --add PCPU

This command requires at least ``--os-placement-api-version 1.30``.

Change-Id: I812e04856df3290a5e4cd7c4ac8f5f47ee566bff

    --dst-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --add PCPU

This command requires at least ``--os-placement-api-version 1.30``.

Change-Id: I812e04856df3290a5e4cd7c4ac8f5f47ee566bff
'}]
commit_message:
Support microversion 1.30 - /reshaper API

The new command ``openstack resource provider allocation reshape`` is
now supported. This treats an atomic change of a given consumer as
followings.

* Take off the given amount of allocations on the source resource class
  from the source resource provider
* Remove the same amount of inventories from the source resource
  provider
* Recreate the given amount of inventories of destination resource
  class in the destination resource provider.
* Create the same amount of allocations on the destination resource
  provider for the consumer

An example to move three VGPU allocations of a consumer from compute RP
to VGPU RP with those VGPU inventories::

  openstack resource provider allocation reshape <consumer_uuid> \
    --src-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --remove VGPU=3 \
    --dst-rp <vgpu_rp_uuid> --add VGPU=3

The source and destination resource provider can be the same provider.
Amount can be omitted to move all the allocations for that resource
class of the consumer::

  openstack resource provider allocation reshape <consumer_uuid> \
    --src-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --remove VCPU \
    --dst-rp <compute_rp_uuid> --add PCPU

This command requires at least ``--os-placement-api-version 1.30``.

Change-Id: I812e04856df3290a5e4cd7c4ac8f5f47ee566bff

commit_message:
Release python-swiftclient for Xena-1 milestone

This is a library release for ospython-swiftclient for the Xena-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.11.1..38c435f
2beddc2 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
58f0700 Fix Typo in shell.py
998bb8b Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
6966fbe Add Python3 xena unit tests
c8b48de Update master for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add OVNEncapType option to the ovn controller template

Since OVN 2.13 it is possible to use vxlan encapsulation in the OVN
tunnel networks.
To do that, it has to be set in the external_ids:ovn-encap-type. There
is support for that in the puppet-ovn module already.
This patch adds missing TripleO-heat-template variable.

Conflicts:
    deployment/ovn/ovn-controller-container-puppet.yaml

Related-bz: #1881697
Change-Id: I54e617745e76f27a4c88156a9b1b17d0255ec837
(cherry picked from commit 1542df355bd22b83baaba1444fc58028046a5185)
(cherry picked from commit b4cec5b729747c3c8cb607c6cd0f6e1821332f06)

messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-11 15:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-05-11 16:09:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Haven't reviewed it in full, but I wonder if we should directly EOL Bifrost, metalsmith and maybe the libraries."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-18 13:39:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Haven't reviewed it in full, but I wonder if we should directly EOL Bifrost, metalsmith and maybe the libraries.

According to your previous discussion [1], at this point I think that it's a bit early for EOL'ing bifrost. The Kolla team requested some more time.

We usually avoid merging patch on EOL deliverables.

Mark, I suppose mostly with his Kolla hat, asked for remaining these branches opened to allow to merge patches. He more or less proposed to lie dormant EM branches, and to consider them as not actively maintained by the core team.

What do you (the ironic team) think about that?

How do you think that Kolla team should deal with the EOL case, if problems occurs and patches couldn't be merged?

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-February/020399.html"}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-05-18 14:11:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since we have downstream product that uses train I don't think we want to EOL now, I would let @Steve and @Julia provide some feedback."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-05-18 17:04:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Since we have downstream product that uses train I don't think we want to EOL now, I would let @Steve and @Julia provide some feedback.

I agree with you concerning the downstream maintenance vs EOL train"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-25 13:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I got the response from Julia on IRC that the team needs some more time [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2021-05-25.log.html#t2021-05-25T13:04:06'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-05-26 06:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We still actively backport to stable/train for a downstream product, but I believe that EM will be appropriate for our needs. We don't need tagged releases. Even reduced CI coverage will be useful."}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-05-26 06:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Happy to +1 this, tks Steve for the confirmation!'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-26 07:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Approved by release liaison. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-05-31 10:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 15:08:36.000000000', 'message': '[ironic] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I8ede3b59b4aba67b0c54e37da8d64cbd4c5782b1
'}]
commit_message:
[ironic] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I8ede3b59b4aba67b0c54e37da8d64cbd4c5782b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 14:20:03.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I8cf2c7a1532e1df454321387a2d49e3f1e5ed1b7

commit_message:
[train-only] Inventory doesn't contain admin password

This breaks the get_swift_client function that uses a password
auth_type. We should instead use the token stored in the inventory.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1962225
Change-Id: Ib53632c30c8eb9f7ebc4dc59043cb51bcb8b81a0

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ic17c37696cac13dd152dc450a91f2702911b830f

[{'created': '2021-05-25 15:14:27.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Set container_client for checks during ffu

Furing FFWD workflow, the validation gets triggered as part of the
pre-upgrade group. When it gets triggered, the environment is in
state where the Undercloud has been upgrade to OSP16.1 (container
engine is podman) but the Overcloud nodes are still on OSP13
(container engine is still docker).

This patch is similar to I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
to check which container cli should be used.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1963879

Change-Id: I98e42d5d7edb0718660a69fab9c1e6c25af2b138

pre-upgrade group. When it gets triggered, the environment is in
state where the Undercloud has been upgrade to OSP16.1 (container
engine is podman) but the Overcloud nodes are still on OSP13
(container engine is still docker).

This patch is similar to I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
to check which container cli should be used.

Change-Id: I98e42d5d7edb0718660a69fab9c1e6c25af2b138
'}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Set container_client for checks during ffu

Furing FFWD workflow, the validation gets triggered as part of the
pre-upgrade group. When it gets triggered, the environment is in
state where the Undercloud has been upgrade to OSP16.1 (container
engine is podman) but the Overcloud nodes are still on OSP13
(container engine is still docker).

This patch is similar to I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
to check which container cli should be used.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1963879

Change-Id: I98e42d5d7edb0718660a69fab9c1e6c25af2b138

commit_message:
Disable delorean repo if a similar componet repo exists

The previous patch disabled the delorean repo
if the job had a component var defined.
This broke validation jobs.

The current patch checks for the existance
of the component repo file before disabling the
delorean repo.

Closes-Bug: #1929695
Change-Id: I88419d24735afd5840225c0d484bc6981738afb7

commit_message:
Re-add NovaVncProxyNetwork to service_net_map.j2.yaml

Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2 removed the NovaVncProxyNetwork
from network/service_net_map.j2.yaml, but due to how hieradata is
being rendered via tripleo-hieradata, the hieradata for the no-vnc-proxy
service falls back to the control plane network.

Change-Id: I595294956a4a7a0e2280c685ac1d2543edbc32f2
Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960401
(cherry picked from commit 36648cf7f041e8a0e5cc8070c1b96b57472c96a8)
(cherry picked from commit 326452e5851e8347b15b53c3d6b70e6f5225f3ea)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-27 16:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'remove requires on monotonic

monotonic dependency was removed when switching to python3.  The
requires on it is not needed. It was previously limited to python < 3.3
but that limit got lost.  There is no current usage in the code
importing monotonic.

https: //review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ceilometer/+/676706
Change-Id: I182dd641893eea7226a5e3afc17132ac973b516b
'}]
commit_message:
remove requires on monotonic

monotonic dependency was removed when switching to python3.  The
requires on it is not needed. It was previously limited to python < 3.3
but that limit got lost.  There is no current usage in the code
importing monotonic.

https: //review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ceilometer/+/676706
Change-Id: I182dd641893eea7226a5e3afc17132ac973b516b

Clean backport'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-05-26 08:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-05-31 08:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 00:56:27.000000000', 'message': "HA-non-DVR router don't need manually add static route

When a router set as HA mode, The keepalived process will take over
the route entry's generation. So, the codes that add static route
is redundant.

But, for DVR-HA router, in dvr_snat node the keepalived process run
in snat-namespace and don't take over qrouter-namespace, so the
manually add static route codes still need be called.

Closes-Bug: #1927849
Change-Id: Id09de6c43c0fab4009336e253c88f54219398053
(cherry picked from commit f192153b449877e00c57c2b2a1b8ce89c9c733da)
"}]
commit_message:
HA-non-DVR router don't need manually add static route

When a router set as HA mode, The keepalived process will take over
the route entry's generation. So, the codes that add static route
is redundant.

But, for DVR-HA router, in dvr_snat node the keepalived process run
in snat-namespace and don't take over qrouter-namespace, so the
manually add static route codes still need be called.

Closes-Bug: #1927849
Change-Id: Id09de6c43c0fab4009336e253c88f54219398053
(cherry picked from commit f192153b449877e00c57c2b2a1b8ce89c9c733da)

Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

commit_message:
Retire sushy-cli - Step 2

The sushy-cli project has been inactive for a while and as announced in
the ML[1] it will be retired.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022405.html

Change-Id: Ifcaf56d2eac6b827f1b6f00d38d91d51ee3f547f

commit_message:
Enable multinode gate.

This patch provides an implementation for joining node to the Kubernetes
cluster by using `kubeadm join` command.

Change-Id: I71d2b99e0c92a12c4e64395f6c4dafa4b69f168f
Depends-On: Ife21874c0a71ba07723094c0f880aabcf5825b77

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I2b3cedb186760772e6f38eee2b7f41b972dac0e1

commit_message:
Separate forwarder condition - with additional debug

In downstream jobs, the conditional check with
'and' condition still fails. This review moves the first
variable defined to run on its own so the second
check should be skipped if the first fails.

This review also uses the public nameserver
to debug and resolve some host names.

Change-Id: Ie570dbfa768baf07513d4c9e08df729c5a05edd7

commit_message:
Update rc to placement in reporting datas when rc changed

When rc is changed in reporting datas, firstly we should ensure the
resource class exists, then delete the old resource class if no rp
using.

Closes-Bug: #1928156

Change-Id: Icb9a06285d7a7b0e134f17163598b9004c329104

Support for Fedora is never tested, and has been unmaintained for
a while. Because we don't expect any actual user using OpenStack on
Fedora, this change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I1230fe902d6c11f77f168b04814c584a3e026a72
"}, {'created': '2021-05-26 09:55:39.000000000', 'message': "Drop Fedora support

Fedora support is never tested, and has been unmaintained for a while.

change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I1230fe902d6c11f77f168b04814c584a3e026a72
"}]
commit_message:
Drop Fedora support

Fedora support is never tested, and has been unmaintained for a while.
Because we don't expect any actual user using OpenStack on Fedora, this
change drops support for Fedora directly.

Change-Id: I1230fe902d6c11f77f168b04814c584a3e026a72

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update
this at each new cycle.

Change-Id: I948a123f71b0e19afaff2086a30566c9d8bcee5d

commit_message:
Cinder Store: Update legacy images tests

update tests for cinder's new attachment API code in glance
cinder store. This leaves a couple of mocks in place for the old
way of doing things so that we can tolerate the old and proposed
changes to glance_store. We can remove those once we require the
newer glance_store version.

Change-Id: If4db20affbba37806f8419b6b30050a32bcc2435

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 01:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update parameters for K8s-VIM

In the detailed design process, the following updates are required.

For VimConnectionInfo data model:
* Modify "ssl_ca_cert_hash" to "ss_ca_cert"
* Delete "certificate_key"

For additionalParams in the request:
* Update parameters for the installation script

Change-Id: Ic1c2876a21f7f5b67ebe9b45f3bb3b493bc44c71
'}]
commit_message:
Update parameters for K8s-VIM

In the detailed design process, the following updates are required.

For VimConnectionInfo data model:
* Modify "ssl_ca_cert_hash" to "ss_ca_cert"
* Delete "certificate_key"

For additionalParams in the request:

messages:

I will rev this a little later.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-04-28 15:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-04-28 15:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-04 14:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Thanks Dan for the detailed spec.
In my opinion this spec solves the Glance quota issue.

Regarding Abhishek question in a previous patch set, I see value in having "image_stage_total" to limit the impact if the worker node disk is used.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-06 18:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(6 comments)

Question inline about the quotas to be implemented, but I'm definitely in favor of this proposal.  Operators have been asking for this for a long time."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-06 19:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Thanks Brian!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-06 19:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-11 05:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I am in favor of this implementation. I have suggested to have new API (may be admin only) to get the information about usage of limits (Total, used, available) but it can be added as a followup enhancement. 

Thank you Dan for putting this together.
Requesting other cores to have a look and raise your comments as early as possible.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-13 15:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-17 05:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-05-18 18:14:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

My biggest worries about the proposal are the soft enforcing opening incredible amounts of race conditions to circumvent the quotas and the amount of holes we have relying the db in calculating the consumption (specially what comes for the staging which is identified as the more critical to address). As it stand at the moment it seem to be pretty trivial to go over your set limits by ten fold.

One more use-case I'd like to capture here, while not necessarily being part of the initial implementation would be per store quotas. I think specifically the edge users would appreciate being able to restrict how much remote site space their users can consume while majority should be utilizing probably just handful of stores (central DC or maybe 2-3 major sites)."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-18 18:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)

> My biggest worries about the proposal are the soft enforcing opening incredible amounts of race conditions to circumvent the quotas 

I assume you mean the one race condition related to competing import/upload operations that can't count against quota until they are complete and we know the size, right? Because glance allows uploading an image of unknown size, we're kinda stuck with that problem today (modulo the improvement this brings with limiting the total number of such operations, mentioned below). Further, the existing global (i.e. non-per-tenant) limits already note this and just check the quota again at the end in the case where the image size is not known ahead of time:

https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/922e544ca2556994450e6972403ba4313318c5e0/glance/quota/__init__.py#L325-L357

I think that per-tenant quota behavior, but with this same caveat, is a clear improvement over what we have today. Enforcing the quota in the actual set_data pipeline is something we could do to further tighten things, but that will require changes to how oslo-limit behaves and also may be undesirable in many circumstances due to the issue I mentioned about throwing away 999GiB of data when you hit the 1TiB quota limit.

What are the other races you're concerned about?

>and the amount of holes we have relying the db in calculating the consumption (specially what comes for the staging which is identified as the more critical to address).

I'm not sure to what holes you're referring here. Presumably one is around images that are already active but are using staging space to copy? I agree that we'll need to count those in some way, and I can figure that out and document it here before we merge if you want, but I think it's a reasonable thing to leave as an implementation detail. Counting images using staging space for glance-direct and web-download is not hard (and the former is already done in my implementation).

What are the other holes?

> As it stand at the moment it seem to be pretty trivial to go over your set limits by ten fold.

This is true today with no quotas (obviously), and true today even with the non-per-tenant limits as noted above. With the addition of the quota on image_count_uploading, the operator can limit the overage to a single operation if they want to, eliminating the "ten fold" concern and getting back to the best-case scenario of being limited by the global image size limit since glance will eat data blindly until that point.

> One more use-case I'd like to capture here, while not necessarily being part of the initial implementation would be per store quotas. I think specifically the edge users would appreciate being able to restrict how much remote site space their users can consume while majority should be utilizing probably just handful of stores (central DC or maybe 2-3 major sites).

Yep, this is definitely something we can add subsequently, by checking a image_size_total_$store limit.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-05-19 12:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> (5 comments)
> 
> > My biggest worries about the proposal are the soft enforcing opening incredible amounts of race conditions to circumvent the quotas 
> 
> I assume you mean the one race condition related to competing import/upload operations that can't count against quota until they are complete and we know the size, right? Because glance allows uploading an image of unknown size, we're kinda stuck with that problem today (modulo the improvement this brings with limiting the total number of such operations, mentioned below). Further, the existing global (i.e. non-per-tenant) limits already note this and just check the quota again at the end in the case where the image size is not known ahead of time:
> 
> https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/922e544ca2556994450e6972403ba4313318c5e0/glance/quota/__init__.py#L325-L357

Well any subsequent inflight creations will go through as long as we have quota left. Being it uploading 10x 1TiB images directly via upload, or 10x 2GiB images that will convert to 300GiB raws to 15 stores via import as long as we do quota check only at the start of any given operation and if the uploading images quota count is done as proposed there can be unlimited number of parallel 'copy-image' jobs to any number of stores going on as well. So the little convenience of allowing any operation to finish when we had any quota left at the request coming in allows us to start plenty of them before we have any updates in the DB pointing out that we're consuming over quota already.

> 
> I think that per-tenant quota behavior, but with this same caveat, is a clear improvement over what we have today. Enforcing the quota in the actual set_data pipeline is something we could do to further tighten things, but that will require changes to how oslo-limit behaves and also may be undesirable in many circumstances due to the issue I mentioned about throwing away 999GiB of data when you hit the 1TiB quota limit.

I guess I'm looking it from the viewpoint of expectations. Currently there is no real expectations part from "We can cap based on our biggest needs" but providing tenant based quotas brings expectations that we let down very quickly if they are enforced maybe next week. Thus I'm wodering if claiming having quotas vs. not having them at all is indeed improvement what comes to pure expectations. 'though Belmiro's responnse indicates that this is improvement to at least those who have understanding and correct expectation how it would work.

> 
> What are the other races you're concerned about?
> 
> >and the amount of holes we have relying the db in calculating the consumption (specially what comes for the staging which is identified as the more critical to address).
> 
> I'm not sure to what holes you're referring here. Presumably one is around images that are already active but are using staging space to copy? I agree that we'll need to count those in some way, and I can figure that out and document it here before we merge if you want, but I think it's a reasonable thing to leave as an implementation detail. Counting images using staging space for glance-direct and web-download is not hard (and the former is already done in my implementation).
> 
> What are the other holes?

Those mainly and I quess we can give conversion a pass as it is effectively admin decision to consume that space and end user has really no say on it.

> 
> > As it stand at the moment it seem to be pretty trivial to go over your set limits by ten fold.
> 
> This is true today with no quotas (obviously), and true today even with the non-per-tenant limits as noted above. With the addition of the quota on image_count_uploading, the operator can limit the overage to a single operation if they want to, eliminating the "ten fold" concern and getting back to the best-case scenario of being limited by the global image size limit since glance will eat data blindly until that point.
> 
> > One more use-case I'd like to capture here, while not necessarily being part of the initial implementation would be per store quotas. I think specifically the edge users would appreciate being able to restrict how much remote site space their users can consume while majority should be utilizing probably just handful of stores (central DC or maybe 2-3 major sites).
> 
> Yep, this is definitely something we can add subsequently, by checking a image_size_total_$store limit.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-19 13:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> if the uploading images quota count is done as proposed there can be unlimited number of parallel 'copy-image' jobs to any number of stores going on as well. So the little convenience of allowing any operation to finish when we had any quota left at the request coming in allows us to start plenty of them before we have any updates in the DB pointing out that we're consuming over quota already.

The above can be included in the uploading quota count and then this isn't a problem

So there are four options that I see:

1. Make this a soft limit as described here, limited by the image_count_uploading.
2. Change Glance's API to start requiring size to be passed during upload (perhaps only for non-admins).
3. Change how oslo-limit works, write another set_data() wrapper, and abort the upload when we hit the quota.
4. Decide that some quotas within the bounds of limitations glance has allowed for years aren't better than nothing and just keep the status quo.

We can do #1 now and then #3 subsequently if people think it's worth it. I'm also on board with #2.

Sounds like you're only on board with #3 or #4, is that correct? Any other options I'm missing?

> I guess I'm looking it from the viewpoint of expectations. Currently there is no real expectations part from "We can cap based on our biggest needs" but providing tenant based quotas brings expectations that we let down very quickly if they are enforced maybe next week. Thus I'm wodering if claiming having quotas vs. not having them at all is indeed improvement what comes to pure expectations. 'though Belmiro's responnse indicates that this is improvement to at least those who have understanding and correct expectation how it would work.

I'm thinking that the current expectations are "Glance should have had quotas a long time ago". I really don't think it will be difficult to explain to people what a soft quota is.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-20 23:00:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

I'm in favor of this.  Since we allow data to be put to glance without knowing the size, I think we have to go with the soft quotas, which could be subject to abuse, but can be controlled to a certain extent by the image_count_uploading setting.  But I think this is a big improvement over the current situation, where everyone has to have a very high limit so that the account that owns the public images can fit them all.  So even though the actual storage consumed by each project will be inexact, it's still a big improvement."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-21 13:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-21 13:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-24 12:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Comment inline about something you could (maybe) add, but otherwise this looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-24 13:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-05-24 13:41:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

I like the direction this takes, and it's something operators have been asking for for a long time."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-24 13:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

In favor of this from the beginning,definitely useful for operators and if not then they can disable the same as well.

One nit (not high priority), fix only if respin is needed.

Thank you Dan and all reviewers!!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-24 14:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-05-31 05:07:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow+1

As discussed in weekly meeting I haven't seen any objection in last couple of days, so approving the spec.

Thank you Dan and all reviewers!!!

Just for a Note:
We need a follow-up efforts to add new API(s) for identifying the usage of quotas."}]

commit_message:
Add OVNEncapType option to the ovn controller template

Since OVN 2.13 it is possible to use vxlan encapsulation in the OVN
tunnel networks.
To do that, it has to be set in the external_ids:ovn-encap-type. There
is support for that in the puppet-ovn module already.
This patch adds missing TripleO-heat-template variable.

Conflicts:
    deployment/ovn/ovn-controller-container-puppet.yaml

Related-bz: #1881697
Change-Id: I54e617745e76f27a4c88156a9b1b17d0255ec837
(cherry picked from commit 1542df355bd22b83baaba1444fc58028046a5185)
(cherry picked from commit b4cec5b729747c3c8cb607c6cd0f6e1821332f06)

[{'created': '2021-05-25 14:56:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix functional jobs

In Change-ID I8db34f31d35375dc9656d53ac7af644c28a3d3fe we updated
api-ref samples, but functional tests didn't run so we didn't detect
that those samples changes broke our functional tests.

This patch fixes the functional tests, updates remaining cases of
key_size, and enables functional tests for api-ref changes to prevent
this from happening again.

Change-Id: I2a1f3121458c2db5e389dbcf31b34d412ffcd561
"}]
commit_message:
Fix functional jobs

In Change-ID I8db34f31d35375dc9656d53ac7af644c28a3d3fe we updated
api-ref samples, but functional tests didn't run so we didn't detect
that those samples changes broke our functional tests.

This patch fixes the functional tests, updates remaining cases of
key_size, and enables functional tests for api-ref changes to prevent
this from happening again.

Change-Id: I2a1f3121458c2db5e389dbcf31b34d412ffcd561

commit_message:
Add tags to THT network resources

This combines several changes that added tags to
network resources into one commit.

Add an index tag on neutron network resources

  When using the multiple nic-config templates in THT
  and in tripleo-ansible the ordering of networks in
  the network_data file matters.

  Add a a tag 'tripleo_net_idx' to neutron resources
  to keep track of the ordering.

Add tripleo_network_name tag hint to networks

  The ansible module to manage networks sets the name
  upper as a tag hint on the neutron network resources.
  tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_composable_network.py#L124

  This change adds this tag for Heat managed networks as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/792196
Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
(cherry picked from commit 2d0125ed4023eb7c524d09a0e5865e8d3e22a492)
(cherry picked from commit 70dc61cc0a5f99ce3d1368dc226ba4292866f22f)
Change-Id: I08b98e9daa625c7c81e50a8ba67bcfc91af37cf0

messages: [{'account_id': 31828, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-05-18 07:38:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-05-30 23:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-14 01:51:37.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I421ebf0bdd7b4ae18e93b2e0836fa7fe13066f1b
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I421ebf0bdd7b4ae18e93b2e0836fa7fe13066f1b

commit_message:
Add an internal index to network_data

When using the multiple nic-config templates in THT
and in tripleo-ansible the ordering of networks in
the network_data file matters.

Add and 'idx' key internally so that we can put a tag
on neutron network resources to keep track of the
ordering.

NOTE: Now also rename unused 'net' variable to '_'.

Change-Id: I6162ee854b08668274df32120e3ffc961b6cf807
Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
(cherry picked from commit ff52ddb3912ade33c9884e415ee260c5a57ab9f7)

commit_message:
Add dependency on OVNMacAddressNetwork for role ResourceGroup

The role ResourceGroup (puppet/role.role.j2.yaml template) tries to
create a port on the OVNMacAddressNetwork, as such we need a dependency
in the top level stack, otherwise the network may not exist before Heat
attempts to create the port.

Change-Id: Ie453fcdbb8eb42bbf718506b0b9b443ccd84543a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7a4a43d55d8437cb154d1ae715b50a586080ff0a)

commit_message:
Drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs template

As we already added horizon-nodejs14-jobs template in this plugin
and nodejs14 jobs running fine. So let's drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs
template because nodejs10 is already EOL.

Change-Id: I11176ef54ca25b130bc2c1c86b8458cbf960312f

commit_message:
Exclude buggy edk2-ovmf for stable branches

c8-stream currently contains two versions of edk2-ovmf, We are
excluding edk2-ovmf-20200602gitca407c7246bf-5 so we use the
lower version edk2-ovmf-20200602gitca407c7246bf-4.el8

This is recommended from compute team that we keep using old version
until bz1961562 [2] is fixed. Fix will come in libvirt[2].

We fixed the check job using [3]. Fixing periodic jobs with this patch.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1961562
[2] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/61d95a1073833ec4323c1ef28e71e913c55aa7b9
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/793098

Related-Bug: #1929634
Change-Id: I0c9019ec31e989394836170bd4fe391a1db1f567

commit_message:
Fix doc job

vitrage-dashboard doc job is failing as requires some font
'tgtermes.sty' to generate pdf doc. This patch adds that required
package in bindep.txt to fix doc job.

Change-Id: Ica19ab980166bb9323b500fbf8359e1496d2afef

tests: Move remaining non-libvirt fixtures

Move these to the central place. There's a large amount of test damage
but it's pretty trivial.

Change-Id: If581eb7aa463c9dde13714f34f0f1b41549a7130
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding nova::network::neutron to nova-conductor

When deploying multiple compute cells, conductor module needs to source
the nova::network::neutron module otherwise the neutron settings are not
configured on the cell conductor node.

Closes-Bug: #1929427
Change-Id: I236ab69175877f8ec5d3b1bef732486ae2b15b9d
(cherry picked from commit 6392cc6620413daefb0bcba3838f303663a4eb58)
(cherry picked from commit 871743dd726973c2ee3c731083d7d83e75f8f4d7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 17:05:53.000000000', 'message': "SQLA 1.4: Fix conditional update Case

There have been changes in the `case` element in SQLAlchemy 1.4 that
break our conditional updates.

Previously SQLA's `case` accepted 3 parameters: whens, value, and else_,
in that order, and we were passing them as positional arguments.

New SQLA has changed, and now the signature is:

    def __init__(self, *whens, **kw):

So we can no longer pass them as positional arguments.

The solution proposed by this patch relies on passing whens as a keyword
argument, which is deprecated in 1.4, because that's the compatible way
between the current SQLA version and 1.4.

Once the minimum version is bumped to 1.4 we can change our code to pass
-    value = case(whens=value.whens,
+    value = case(**value.whens,

Closes-Bug: #1928083
Change-Id: Ia5c4d06affc5acd9a4783f217b6c5375afab50ed
"}, {'created': '2021-05-12 18:20:11.000000000', 'message': "SQLA 1.4: Fix conditional update Case

There have been changes in the `case` element in SQLAlchemy 1.4 that
break our conditional updates.

Previously SQLA's `case` accepted 3 parameters: whens, value, and else_,
in that order, and we were passing them as positional arguments.

New SQLA has changed, and now the signature is:

    def __init__(self, *whens, **kw):

So we can no longer pass them as positional arguments.

The solution proposed by this patch relies on passing whens as a keyword
argument, which is deprecated in 1.4, because that's the compatible way
between the current SQLA version and 1.4.

Once the minimum version is bumped to 1.4 we can change our code to pass
-    value = case(whens=value.whens,
+    value = case(*value.whens,

Closes-Bug: #1928083
Change-Id: Ia5c4d06affc5acd9a4783f217b6c5375afab50ed
"}]
commit_message:
SQLA 1.4: Fix conditional update Case

There have been changes in the `case` element in SQLAlchemy 1.4 that
break our conditional updates.

Previously SQLA's `case` accepted 3 parameters: whens, value, and else_,
in that order, and we were passing them as positional arguments.

New SQLA has changed, and now the signature is:

    def __init__(self, *whens, **kw):

So we can no longer pass them as positional arguments.

The solution proposed by this patch relies on passing whens as a keyword
argument, which is deprecated in 1.4, because that's the compatible way
between the current SQLA version and 1.4.

Once the minimum version is bumped to 1.4 we can change our code to pass
-    value = case(whens=value.whens,
+    value = case(*value.whens,

Closes-Bug: #1928083
Change-Id: Ia5c4d06affc5acd9a4783f217b6c5375afab50ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-29 17:29:53.000000000', 'message': "[OFTC] +s channel mode

According to OFTC docs [1]:
s - secret, channel will not show up in /whois unless clients
    share the channel

It seems to be used by the Debian community and may prevent some
spam and increase users' privacy.

[1] https://www.oftc.net/ChannelModes/

Change-Id: I2314ec884409c0db0d6ef2590bdf8426f1033c4a
"}]
commit_message:
[OFTC] +s channel mode

According to OFTC docs [1]:
s - secret, channel will not show up in /whois unless clients
    share the channel

It seems to be used by the Debian community and may prevent some
spam and increase users' privacy.

[1] https://www.oftc.net/ChannelModes/

Change-Id: I2314ec884409c0db0d6ef2590bdf8426f1033c4a
